DOC.brief_title: Microbiome Urologic Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: This research do learn bacteria live genito-urinary tract subject urologic chronic pelvic pain syndrome ( UCPPS ) . A microbiome define `` ecological community commensal , symbiotic , pathogenic microorganism literally share body space . '' ( Lederberg , 2001 ) The present study design establish prostate , urinary bladder urethral microbiome men chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome urinary bladder urethral microbiome woman interstitial cystitis/painful bladder syndrome . The human urethra , bladder prostate normally harbor microbial community . The recent advent large-scale `` omics '' technology allow detailed analysis community . While current knowledge normal inhabitant human urogenital tract remain incomplete , 90 % patient UCPPS report onset symptom follow `` urinary tract infection '' . The causative agent case remain unknown , partly due limitation old detection technology require detection isolation single microorganism implicate causative agent . Furthermore , many microbial specie remain unculturable therefore , often undetectable use standard technology . The current project utilize state-of-the-art `` omic '' technology detect identify microbial specie urethra bladder men woman prostate men . Additionally , inflammatory response accompany microbial community characterize . Finally , presence number microbial specie correlate intensity inflammatory response severity symptom patient UCPPS experience .
DOC.criteria: Consent : Participant sign date Informed Consent document , approve Johns Hopkins Medical Institutions Institutional Review Board ; Agreement : Participant agree participate study procedure ; Age : Participant least 18 year age ; Symptom Severity : Participant report response least 8 Pain Domain NIHChronic Prostatitis Symptom Index ( CPSI ) Questionnaire ; Duration Symptoms : Symptoms present least 3 month within precede 6 month . Urethral condition : Participant ongoing symptomatic urethral stricture ; Bladder condition : Participant history cystitis cause tuberculosis , radiation therapy cytoxan/cyclophosphamide therapy , augmentation cystoplasty cystectomy ; Testicular condition : Participant diagnose unilateral orchialgia , without pelvic symptom ; Prostate condition procedure : Participant history transurethral microwave thermotherapy ( TUMT ) , transurethral needle ablation ( TUNA ) , balloon dilation , prostate cryosurgery , laser procedure ; Neurological diseases disorder affect bladder : Parkinson disease , multiple system atrophy , multiple sclerosis , spinal cord injury , cervical myelopathy , acute transverse myelitis , diabetic cystopathy , dysfunctional voiding ( nonneurogenic neurogenic bladder Hinman syndrome ) ; Psychiatric condition : Participant current major psychiatric disorder psychiatric medical issue would interfere study participation ( e.g . dementia , psychosis , upcoming major surgery , etc . ) ; Malignancy : Participant history cancer ( exception skin cancer ) . Control group exclusion criterion : In addition exclusion criterion list , additional criterion control subject follow : Chronic Pain : In past year , symptom discomfort pain pelvic region period longer 3 month within precede year ; Infection : Volunteers urinary tract infection urine culture value > 100,000 colony form units/ml ( CFU/ml ) within past three month . Intravesical Therapy : Volunteers treat intravesical chemotherapy Bacillus CalmetteGuerin ( BCG ) therapy ; Gastrointestinal Conditions : Volunteers inflammatory bowel disease ( Crohn 's disease ulcerative colitis , irritable bowel syndrome ) .
